greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(-1) = 1 and g.f. A(x) satisfies A(x) - 1 / A(x) = 1 / x - 1.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = -1..2500
formula: a(n) = Sum_{j=0..floor((n+1)/2)} (-1)^(j-1)*binomial(2*j-1, j)*binomial(n-1, 2*j-2))/(2*j-1), n >= 0, a(-1)=1. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, May 28 2014
-1/A(-x) is the o.g.f. for A007440. Lucas(n) = [x^n] (-x*A(-x))^n for n >= 1. - _Peter Bala_, Jun 23 2015
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1-x + Sqrt[1-2*x+5*x^2])/2, {x, 0, 50}], x] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 10 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local( A ); if( n<-1, 0, A = 1 / x + O(x^0); forstep( k = -1, n, 2, A = 1 / x - 1 + 1 / A ); polcoeff( A, n ) )};
a(n):=if n=-1 then 1 else sum(((-1)^(j-1)*binomial(2*j-1,j)*binomial(n-1,2*j-2))/(2*j-1),j,0,(n+1)/2); /* _Vladimir Kruchinin_, May 28 2014 */
(MAGMA) m:=50; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Rationals(), m); Coefficients(R!((1-x + Sqrt(1-2*x+5*x^2))/2)); // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 10 2018
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jul 24 2012
